security

Class PasswordCheckerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • security.PasswordCheckerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PasswordChecker

    public class PasswordCheckerImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements PasswordChecker

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PasswordCheckerImpl() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkPassword()
      Updates the Password Strength meter on the fly based on: Password Length: 5 Points: Less than 4 characters 10 Points: 5 to 7 characters 25 Points: 8 or more Letters: 0 Points: No letters 10 Points: Letters are all lower case OR all upper case 20 Points: Letters are upper case and lower case Numbers: 0 Points: No numbers 10 Points: 1 or 2 numbers 20 Points: 3 or more numbers Characters: 0 Points: No characters 10 Points: 1 character 25 Points: More than 1 character Bonus: 2 Points: Letters and numbers 3 Points: Letters, numbers, and characters 5 Points: Mixed case letters, numbers, and characters Password strength is measure by the percent of the above: >= 90: Very Secure >= 80: Secure >= 70: Very Strong >= 60: Strong >= 50: Average >= 25: Weak >= 0: Very Weak
      void init()
      Set up the dictionary
      void setUpReferences(javax.swing.JPasswordField passwordString1, javax.swing.JTextField strengthColor)
      Sets up class references

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        Sets up class references

        Parameters:
        passwordString1 - the first password field
        strengthColor - the field to alter to display the password strength

      • checkPassword

        public void checkPassword()
        Updates the Password Strength meter on the fly based on: Password Length: 5 Points: Less than 4 characters 10 Points: 5 to 7 characters 25 Points: 8 or more Letters: 0 Points: No letters 10 Points: Letters are all lower case OR all upper case 20 Points: Letters are upper case and lower case Numbers: 0 Points: No numbers 10 Points: 1 or 2 numbers 20 Points: 3 or more numbers Characters: 0 Points: No characters 10 Points: 1 character 25 Points: More than 1 character Bonus: 2 Points: Letters and numbers 3 Points: Letters, numbers, and characters 5 Points: Mixed case letters, numbers, and characters Password strength is measure by the percent of the above: >= 90: Very Secure >= 80: Secure >= 70: Very Strong >= 60: Strong >= 50: Average >= 25: Weak >= 0: Very Weak
        Specified by:
        checkPassword in interface PasswordChecker
        Since:
        2.0
        See Also:
        http://www.scism.sbu.ac.uk/jfl/Appa/appa4.html
